Domain events are similar to messaging-style events, with one important difference. With real messaging, message queuing, message brokers, or a service bus using AMQP, a message is sent asynchronously and communicated across processes and machines. This is useful for multiple Bounded Contexts, microservices, or even different applications. However, with events, you want to raise an event from the domain operation you’re currently running, but any side effects to occur within the same domain.
